    • saveUserTokenToRepository

      private void saveUserTokenToRepository(User user, String accessToken)
      Saves the user's access token to the token repository.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose access token is to be saved.
      accessToken - The user's access token.

    • revokeAllTokensForUser

      private void revokeAllTokensForUser(User user)
      Revokes all valid tokens for the specified user by marking them as expired and revoked.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose tokens should be revoked.

    • register

      public AuthenticationResponse register(RegistrationRequest request)
      Registers a new user by validating the provided registration details and saving the user in the system. The method generates an access token and a refresh token for successful registration. If the registration is successful, a new AuthenticationResponse object is returned to the client, containing the user's information, access token, and refresh token.
      Parameters:
      request - the RegistrationRequest object containing the user's registration details, such as first name, last name, email, and password
      Returns:
      an AuthenticationResponse object containing the user's information, access token, and refresh token
      Throws:
      BadRequestException - if the provided email is already registered, or any of the required fields are empty * or null.
      InternalServerErrorException - if an unexpected error occurs during the registration process

    • validateRegistrationRequest

      private void validateRegistrationRequest(RegistrationRequest request) throws IOException
      Validates the registration request by checking if the provided email is already registered and ensuring that none of the required fields are empty or null.
      Parameters:
      request - The registration request containing the user's information.
      Throws:
      BadRequestException - if the provided email is already registered, or any of the required fields (firstname, lastname, email and password) are empty or null.
      IOException

    • authenticate

      public AuthenticationResponse authenticate(AuthenticationRequest request)
      Authenticates a user by validating their credentials and generating an access token and a refresh token for successful authentication. The method uses the AuthenticationManager to validate the provided email and password and checks if the user exists in the system. If the authentication is successful, a new access token and refresh token are generated, and an AuthenticationResponse object is returned to the client.
      Parameters:
      request - the AuthenticationRequest object containing the user's email and password for authentication
      Returns:
      an AuthenticationResponse object containing the user's information, access token, and refresh token
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException - if the provided email and password combination is invalid or the user is not found
      InternalServerErrorException - if an unexpected error occurs during the authentication process

    • validateAuthenticationRequest

      private void validateAuthenticationRequest(AuthenticationRequest request)
      Validates the authentication request by ensuring that none of the required fields (email and password) are empty or null.
      Parameters:
      request - The authentication request containing the user's email and password.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException - if any of the required fields (email and password) are empty or null.

    • handleTokenRefreshRequest

      public void handleTokenRefreshRequest(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException
      Handles a token refresh request by validating the provided refresh token, generating a new access token, and returning an updated authentication response to the client. This method ensures the security of the authentication process by validating the tokens and checking for the existence of the user in the system.
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the client request, including the refresh token in the "Authorization" header.
      response - the HttpServletResponse object that will contain the updated authentication response with a new access token and other user information.
      Throws:
      BadRequestException - if the token format in the request header is invalid.
      NotFoundException - if the user is not found for the provided refresh token.
      org.springframework.security.authentication.BadCredentialsException - if the provided refresh token is invalid.
      IOException - if an error occurs while writing the authentication response to the output stream.
      InternalServerErrorException - if an unexpected error occurs during token refresh.
